alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 3:28PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MCKINLEY... SOUTHWESTERN RIO ARRIBA...NORTHWESTERN SANDOVAL AND SOUTHEASTERN SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds 7 miles north of Pueblo Pintado, or 36 miles west of Cuba, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern McKinley, southwestern Rio Arriba, northwestern Sandoval and southeastern San Juan Counties. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 101 and 107. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Localized gusty winds to 50 mph are possible in the vicinity of these funnel clouds. Localized damage to lightweight structures such as outbuildings, carports and patio covers, as well as tree branches and street signs, is possible.
